Uses of Interface
com.joliciel.talismane.parser.output.ParseConfigurationProcessor

  • Packages that use ParseConfigurationProcessor 
    Package Description
    com.joliciel.talismane
    Entry-point package for Talismane - for simple usage code samples, see the com.joliciel.talismane.examples package.
    com.joliciel.talismane.extensions.corpus
    Various extensions for corpus manipulation and analysis, including classes for autoamtically modifying or projectifying a corpus, and classes for calculating corpus statistics.
    com.joliciel.talismane.extensions.standoff
    A package for converting to and from CoNLL-X to standoff format, for interaction with annoation tools requiring this format.
    com.joliciel.talismane.parser.evaluate
    Evaluation of transition-based parsing.
    com.joliciel.talismane.parser.output
    Package for outputting parser results.

    • Uses of ParseConfigurationProcessor in com.joliciel.talismane

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<ParseConfigurationProcessor> Talismane.getParseConfigurationProcessors() 

    • Uses of ParseConfigurationProcessor in com.joliciel.talismane.extensions.corpus

      Classes in com.joliciel.talismane.extensions.corpus that implement ParseConfigurationProcessor 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CorpusModifier
      Modifies a corpus in simple ways, by replacing labels with other ones, or removing dependencies.
      Each rule has the following format
      GOVPOS\tGOV\tDEPPOS\tDEP\tLABEL\tACTION\tNEWLABEL
      Where GOVPOS is the governor's pos-tag, or * for any.
      GOV is the governor's word form, or * for any.
      DEPPOS is the dependent's pos-tag, or * for any
      DEP is the dependent's word form, or * for any
      LABEL is the current label, or * for any
      ACTION is either Replace or Remove
      NEWLABEL is a new label, only required if action is Replace.
      Any line starting with # is ignored.
      class  CorpusProjectifier
      Transforms a non-projective corpus to a projective corpus by attaching non-projective arcs to a projective head.
      Does not write any output directly - this needs to be taken care of by another ParseConfigurationProcessor.

      The strategy for selecting the projective head is as follows:
      A non-projective relationship involves two arcs which cross each other.
      class  CorpusStatisticsWriter
      A class for gathering and writing statistics from a given corpus.
      class  NonProjectiveStatisticsWriter
      A class for gathering statistics from a given corpus.

    • Uses of ParseConfigurationProcessor in com.joliciel.talismane.extensions.standoff

      Classes in com.joliciel.talismane.extensions.standoff that implement ParseConfigurationProcessor 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  StandoffSentenceWriter
      Writes standoff sentences readable by the Brat annotation tool: see http://brat.nlplab.org/ To be useable by Brat, these need to be accompanied in the same directory by annotations written using the StandoffWriter.
      class  StandoffWriter
      Writes standoff annotations readable by the Brat annotation tool: see http://brat.nlplab.org/ To be useable by Brat, these need to be accompanied in the same directory by sentences written using the StandoffSentenceWriter.

      class  FreemarkerParseWriter
      Processes parser output by writing via a freemarker template.
      class  ParseFeatureTester 
      class  ParseOutputRewriter 
      class  TransitionLogWriter
      Writes the list of transitions that were actually applied, one at a time.
      Methods in com.joliciel.talismane.parser.output that return types with arguments of type ParseConfigurationProcessor 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.List<ParseConfigurationProcessor> ParseConfigurationProcessor.getProcessors(java.io.Writer writer, java.io.File outDir, TalismaneSession session)
      Collect the processors specified in the configuration key talismane.core.[sessionId].parser.output.processors.

      Each processor must implement this interface and must have a constructor matching one of the following signatures:
      - ( File outputDir, TalismaneSession session)
      - ( TalismaneSession session)

      Optionally, it can have a constructor with the following signature:
      - ( Writer writer, TalismaneSession session)
      If a writer is provided here, then the first processor with the above constructor will be given the writer.
